project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Emergency Recovery and Community Support Project for the Republic of Congo is to assist the recovery of communities living in smaller municipalities and rural areas (i.e. all areas outside the two main cities of  Brazzaville and Pointe Noire). The program comprises four components: (i) Financing of priority local investments; (ii) Support to community organizations (iii) Capacity enhancement for central and local governments; and (iv) Balance of payments support. The Project is  expected to assist Congo's stabilization and recovery process by: (i) contributing to improving living conditions in areas which to date have received limited external support and where poverty is  acute; (ii) helping strengthen civil society in rural areas and small towns; (iii) facilitating the decentralization process and the effective provision of basic social services outside Brazzaville and Pointe Noire; and (iv) helping maintain the pace of economic reforms. The main risks are the possibility of renewed violence in some areas, difficulties on the path to reform, and a compromised administrative capacity for implementation.
